The minimal array size would be when the min and max are the same. In that case, the count of elements must satisfy both l1 < = count <= r1 and l2 <= count <= r2. So the count has to be in the intersection of [l1, r1] and [l2, r2]. If there's an overlap, then the minimal possible is the minimal of the overlapping region's lower bound.
